ci_support_linux_64_python3.10.____cpyth:
c_compiler:
- gcc
c_compiler_version:
- '14'
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cxx_compiler:
- gxx
cxx_compiler_version:
- '14'
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  python:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
python:
- 3.10.* *_cpython
target_platform:
- linux-64
zip_keys:
- - c_compiler_version
  - cxx_compiler_version
zlib:
- '1'

about.description:
YODA is a small set of data analysis (specifically histogramming) classes
being developed by MCnet members as a lightweight common system for MC
event generator validation analyses, particularly as the core histogramming
system in Rivet.
about.summary: Yet more Objects for Data Analysis

being developed by MCnet members as a lightweight common system for MC
event generator validation analyses, particularly as the core histogramming
system in Rivet.
about.summary: Yet more Objects for Data Analysis

event generator validation analyses, particularly as the core histogramming
system in Rivet.

name: yoda

about.description:
YODA is a small set of data analysis (specifically histogramming) classes
being developed by MCnet members as a lightweight common system for MC
event generator validation analyses, particularly as the core histogramming
system in Rivet.
about.summary: Yet more Objects for Data Analysis

about.description:
YODA is a small set of data analysis (specifically histogramming) classes
being developed by MCnet members as a lightweight common system for MC
event generator validation analyses, particularly as the core histogramming
system in Rivet.
about.summary: Yet more Objects for Data Analysis

raw_meta_yaml:
schema_version: 1

context:
  name: yoda
  version: "2.1.2"

package:
  name: ${{ name|lower }}
  version: ${{ version }}

source:
  url: https://yoda.hepforge.org/downloads?f=YODA-${{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: fa181b21d02939e7ce84534b8c10659a19b7398da651188d260322ba80cbd1d2
  file_name: YODA-${{ version }}.tar.gz
  # Can't apply patches here, see: https://github.com/prefix-dev/rattler-build/issues/1418
  # patches:
  #   - 0001-Fix-setting-rpath-when-installing-on-macOS.patch
  #   - 0002-Support-overriding-install_name_tool.patch
  #   - 0003-Do-not-link-against-libpython.patch

build:
  number: 0
  skip: win

requirements:
  build:
    - if: build_platform != target_platform
      then:
        - python
        - cross-python_${{ target_platform }}
    - if: unix
      then: gnuconfig
    - ${{ compiler('c') }}
    - ${{ stdlib("c") }}
    - ${{ compiler('cxx') }}
    - pkg-config
    - make
    - autoconf
    - automake
    - libtool
    # Required due to https://github.com/prefix-dev/rattler-build/issues/1418
    - patch
    - tar
  host:
    - python
    - cython >=0.24
    - zlib
  run:
    - python
    - matplotlib-base

tests:
  - python:
      imports:
        - yoda
  - script:
      - root2yoda --help
      - yoda-config --help
      - yoda2root --help
      - yoda2yoda --help
      - yodacnv --help
      - yodadiff --help
      - yodaenvelope --help
      - yodals --help
      - yodamerge --help
      - yodaplot --help
      - yodascale --help
      - yodastack --help

about:
  license: GPL-3.0-only
  license_file: COPYING
  summary: Yet more Objects for Data Analysis
  description: |
    YODA is a small set of data analysis (specifically histogramming) classes
    being developed by MCnet members as a lightweight common system for MC
    event generator validation analyses, particularly as the core histogramming
    system in Rivet.


  homepage: https://yoda.hepforge.org/
  repository: https://gitlab.com/hepcedar/yoda/
  documentation: https://gitlab.com/hepcedar/yoda/

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - chrisburr
    - conda-forge/hepmc3
